intro: Dryadella rodrigoi, commonly known as the Rodrigues dryadella, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth, where it thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dryadella rodrigoi is considered a vulnerable species.
